Reviews.Title: “Stay in Ambassadors hotel”
Reviews.Author: Peter Z Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed in many hotels in my life, but hardly saw any hotel like this one. The automatic door that you see on the picture, wasn't working. So you had to squeeze your hands in between these doors and push it open. Cables where hanging out of the ceiling. Rooms where terribly small and outdated. In bathroom, you couldn't even turn yourself, that small. You had to go in first, before you could turn yourself and close the door. Otherwise you couldn't even sit on the toilet, because the door hit the toilet when opening it. On day of arrival I had to pay 5 pound just to put my hand luggage there because I couldn't check in yet. Breakfast is overpriced. Better walk towards to the underground station and have breakfast there. It's cheaper and prepared fresh.

Reviews.Title: “Good quality-money”
Reviews.Author: Paula R Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a good location and it's worthy. It's clean and in a good location, quite central. The only thing is that when I make the reservation it said that it has free internet, and it doesn't, you have to pay for internet.

Reviews.Title: “A Stay in Central London”
Reviews.Author: prhlichfield
Reviews.Content: Excellent location. Perfect for Gloucester Road tube station and access to central London. Perfect for going to the football at Chelsea. Automatic door at the front of the hotel did not work. The single room was VERY small. The furntiture was cheap and old. The TV was ancient. The bathroom tiles were cracked. The shower curtain was too short to stop water leaking. THe hot and cold taps were fitted the wrong way around. £5 to leave you back in the hotel was excessive. Did not have breakfast (at £8.50 orr £10) as it is cheaper to eat by the tube station. Room was quiet. Bed was clean and room was tidied efficiently each day. £53 a night for cnetral London was not bad.

Reviews.Title: “Small but Clean”
Reviews.Author: Holly M
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through a travel agency, and it was the best one out of the two. I was nervous to stay here from the reviews I saw, but I was pleasently surprised. The hotel is located in a very nice area of London. The staff we encountered were all very friendly and heplful. Our room looked as if it had just been remodeled. There is an underground station located close to the hotel. It is a good, safe place to leave your luggage and explore the city.

Reviews.Title: “A place to leave your suitcases and go sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: Ania K
Reviews.Content: The place won't make the best first impression. Staff is very freindly, rooms are clena but small, could benefit from refurbishment. Enjoyed the location in the south -west part of London, with some pubs and bars around. Don't expect anything wild though!

Reviews.Title: “never again”
Reviews.Author: ritinha_8
Reviews.Content: The hotel is cold. Noisy. Messy. Old. The rooms are small. The bathroom is all broken and not ventilated. Leave out the smell of the toilet in the room. The smell is nauseating during the entire stay. The hotel need reforms. The breakfast room is in the works and the breakfast buffet is served in boxes to be eaten in the room. The hotel does not have the heating on unless some time during the night. The window glass lets through the street noise. You can not sleep with the noise of the cars all night. The hotel is very, very dirty or in rooms or in hallways. Undertake to check out at 11 o'clock in the morning and take 5 pounds to keep the bag! Never again

Reviews.Title: “I'm still traumatised...affordable but not worth it!!!”
Reviews.Author: Ellen M
Reviews.Content: We checked in with my boyfriend for 4 nights from last Tuesday and checked out on Saturday. I have to say this is the worst hotel I've ever stayed at. Bathroom is old, and shower curtain is dirty (rail all rusted). Ceiling has black marks, and basin is too small. Our room was not cleaned the first day (for some reason). Second day we had to ask one of the ladies standing on the corridore not to 'forget' to clean it, and she could not understand a thing we were saying as 'she no speak English'. We come back from sighseeing and shopping and the bathroom was 'cleaned'. Hair all over the bathtub - yes my own hair bvut I was not expecting to find it there, right? My face cloth was on the floor - and all damp. How??? Carpets on the corridor are old, very stuffy smell. Bed was fine, room was okay - small but okay as we didn't have a lot of luggage. Staff at reception was very unfriendly. You have to buy internet vouchers. We wanted to buy the 24 hours voucher for Â£5 and they didn't have. They only had the 1 hour, for Â£1 vouchers - just as well. It was ridiculously slow and we couldn't do anything we wanted to. We had to go to the Starbucks to access the internet. It's not a 3 star hotel, I agree with one of the reviewers - it is in the minuses. If you want value for your money, DO NOT STAY AT THIS HOTEL!!!

Reviews.Title: “Never had such bad service”
Reviews.Author: Mel I
Reviews.Content: The reviews warn of basic which isn't a problem for my boyfriend and me, as we most often stay at hostels or camp and, man, do we wish that we had done the same for our weekend in London. We arrive to a tight, overheated room (yes, we did let the staff know that the room was exceptionally warm) with no working television, but we didnâ€™t care. We consider our troubles to have begun the next morning, when we woke up early to see a little more of the town and then catch our flight out. Instead, my clothing was soaked and stained from the radiator busting overnight. I called down to ask what can they do, can they clean my pants, I was only traveling with one pair. No, they said they could do nothing. They didn't even show concern for the water in the room. A hour and half later, I gave up on trying to try the pants with a hair dryer (as it had stopped working) and left the room in thermals. I went down to speak to the front desk while my boyfriend was still in the room. The ladies at the front desk all told me they could do nothing. I asked for their manager and waited almost an hour for him. His first words to me were, "What are you doing to flood the room". It didn't get any better from there. During the time that I waited, the manager had sent personnel into the room (keep in mind, I had reported the problem 3 hours prior and they hadn't sent anyone and at the time they did send someone, we had still not checked out). Despite having already sent someone (again, unbeknownst to my boyfriend and me), he asked that he be shown the damage in the room in addition to the damaged clothing I was already displaying to him (another stall tactic). He acknowledged that the radiator burst but took no responsibility for the damage it caused. What's worse is that he said that there was nothing he could do about it. When I directly asked that we not be charged for the room, he laughed at me and said, "You are joking". I asked him why we were made to wait for over an hour on his decision if he had no power to correct the problem. He then gave an e-mail address, no name, of someone who could be contacted for resolve. As you can image, that his statements all came across as rude and disrespectful, no apology or acceptance of responsibility. We lost 3 hours of our time in London and I caught a cold, presumably from walking around, in the cold, in long-underwear. A week later, I haven't received a response to the polite, professional e-mail my boyfriend sent to the given address, but I pledge to update this post should there be a reply (but I think we all know that an email address is a brush off). While I waited in the lobby, I heard one customer complain about the nature of the food and the hotel receptionist respond that that wasn't their fault because they had order food from an outside restaurant since their hotel was under renovations. Three other hotel guests were appalled they were asked to pay 15 pounds to hold their, in total, 3 small bags for the day. During a common check out time, not one customer had anything nice to say about their stay which let me know that our incident was not an unfortunate coincidence but the result of bad management of a subpar hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very basic”
Reviews.Author: ldeayton
Reviews.Content: In fairness my room was clean, bed was comfortable and the bathroom was fine although there was no water pressure. I wouldn't stay here for a romantic weekend but as somewhere to crash out for a night its OK...just OK.

Reviews.Title: “Appalling customer service”
Reviews.Author: shirleyf186273
Reviews.Content: We checked in given the key and directed to our room which was downstairs, we were told it was the only floor with air conditioning. We entered our room to discover that it was already occupied as items were out in the room, of course we returned to reception. No apology or explanation, they just gave us another key. So if on 2 Oct 2011 you stayed in room 321, are you aware that other guests entered your room whilst you were out? Our new room 105 was lovely and we were very pleased, but only until the next morning. During my morning shower we had a power failure. Reported lack of electrics to reception, lights came back on but we still had on other electrics. I phoned reception again to report this but an hour later, and check out time, we still did not have any power. I left the hotel with wet hair and without an explanation or apology. I have since sent two emails to the hotel and I have not even received an acknowledgement on my complaint.

Reviews.Title: “Ok but only ok.”
Reviews.Author: Ptarmigan15
Reviews.Content: I've used this hotel on and off for a few years. The location is great - short walk to the Gloucester Road Tube. Unfortunately the rooms are a very mixed bag one has to say. My latest room was not bad, clean and the bed was ok, but the bathroom was complete rubbish. Basin was tiny and the shower was very old fashioned and very awkward to use. A spot of modernisation would not go amiss. The restaurant is closed at present for refurbishment, but previously it served a decent breakfast. It is ok for a day or two.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy”
Reviews.Author: Republicofdenmark
Reviews.Content: This hotel is reasonbly priced, location is great and it is clean and tidy. However.... It is incredibly noisy. The walls are paper-thin and there is constantly doors opening and closing. On top of this, the cleaners were chatting in the hall way alk day long and at the time of writing the restaurant is closed due to renovation. This means more noise as the builders are worling throughout the day. Not to be recommended despite reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Money grabbers, conmen!!!”
Reviews.Author: Patrizia1961
Reviews.Content: I went to London with my sister for a couple of days, and because I know London's hotel I knew that the hotel there are a risk. So I came in this hotel not knowing what I would find. The first impression was reassuring the room was small but seamed clean and new and the staff seamed nice. At night we couldn't sleep well there was a buzzing noise coming from the electrical control panel in the room and the door of the guests returning in the early morning slamming the doors continuously. The first morning we discover that all the plugs weren't working our mobile phones hadnâ€™t been charged and believe me we tried and tried with the switch on, off, nothing and the shave plug in the bathroom was broken too. We went upstairs to have breakfast, that wasn't included in the price, there was a lady standing in front of a little desk, like if she was in charge of assigning a table, she ask us to go to the reception to pay in advance and so we did. Than we return to the lady and she disappear in a close by door to return with two paper bags with our â€œno warm coffee or tea breakfastâ€�. Astonished I ask to the lady where we were supposed to go to have breakfast, and she said that the breakfast room it was undergoing refurbishment and we could go in our room. Yes, on my bed linen...sure!! I told them that I would have like to be informed about it before paying, to have a choice. The answer was a stone silence, glances between staff, they knew it was done in bad fath and it wasn't the fist time they did it nor was going to be the last. Not an offer to refund, nothing!!. Money grabbers, little conmen, even to leave the suitcases they charge Â£ 5.00. I told them that considering they stole the money for the breakfast i couldn't have the list they could do is to spare us the money for the suitcases, the answer was "Sorry madam but I do what I am told to do". Disgusting to say the list. Not to mention that the elevator the last day wasn't working and we had to take our suitcases up the stairs. Would I recommend this hotel? Not to my worse enemy.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but decent”
Reviews.Author: Mark S
Reviews.Content: I needed a reasonably-priced hotel for a business trip and after seeing the nearby Holiday Inn was quite extortionate, I plumped for this one. I'll admit to some apprehension based on previous reviews, but it was unfounded. I was in a single room, which had plenty space for one person. The bed was as comfy as I've had anywhere and the bathroom was clean, although perhaps a tad small - the shower door hit the sink. But it was still able to get in and out OK. The usual tea/coffee facilities and TV were provided, along with coat hangers. There was no view to speak of, but I didn't really care: who spends their time in London looking out a hotel window. I just needed somewhere to put my head down at night, and this more than passed. I didn't opt to pay for breakfast, because I'm not a big eater in the mornings so was able to grab something at the nearby Sainsbury's instead. All-in-all, don't be put off by the negative reviews; this hotel is really worth a try.

Reviews.Title: “rip off”
Reviews.Author: metal29
Reviews.Content: booked this hotel with www.booking.com these booking sites dont seem to checkout or care what hotel owners put on there site just as long as they get there commission so would no put any trust in there description of a hotel or its facilities i stayed here in September and the hotel is very over priced i paid Â£104 for a single room with out listing all the details like shifting rooms twice and still not getting a descent room tv etc just do yourself a favor and book somewhere else the rooms are worth about Â£45 max

Reviews.Title: “Best to save money on a good location”
Reviews.Author: Omar-Alaqeel
Reviews.Content: This hotel is good in room service but terrible how the rooms are small . However it has a great location. I would recommend it for group travelers because this hotel is money saver and it's more like last resort to stay if you can't find another one

Reviews.Title: “Worse than our expectation”
Reviews.Author: Francesco A
Reviews.Content: Photos and reality are two very different concepts. We paid for a double room but we were 4 inside; we and two other cockroachs!!! Photos on the website show a great hotel and they are not 3 stars for me they are almost 2! The carpet was dirty, pealed out and smelled bad. Room was very small, the internet point computer was unconfortable. The bathroom was the smallest IÂ´ve ever seen and to close the door I had to put me almost on the WC. The heating system was broken and in the room there was only a dangerous electric heater. The only positive point is the location, in a good area of London. It didnÂ´t worth the price we paid. Absolutely.

Reviews.Title: “A good budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: lordym
Reviews.Content: A good budget hotel. Rooms are a bit small but clean and in a central position.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended at this price”
Reviews.Author: SurajBad
Reviews.Content: Very close to the Earl's Court tube station, and we are glad we elected Earl's Court, because the day we arrived, one of the train lines had some problem and luckily, Earl's Court has two different train lines, and so we could take a detour. The hotel is really nice, located on a cozy (but busy) street, around 7 mins walk from Earl's Court tube station. The rooms are small, but you can't expect more in London at this price. Rooms are well maintained with a tea / coffee maker, and all other basic amenities. The bathroom is not too small, well maintained and clean. Most of the staff is very friendly and helpful. Overall, recommended, because of te location and cleanliness.

Reviews.Title: “Not coming back there...”
Reviews.Author: ChiaraG72
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Ambassadors 3 nights, to visit London. The only reason you may want to stay there is the location but you can find much better. The rooms were way to tiny. Our room was probably a single room were they put two beds together, we only could access the bed from one side. The room was dusty and noisy. Very boring hotel. The staff at the reception is like they were sleeping, I don't think they know the meaning of "smile" or "serviceminded"...you can easily find a much better place to stay in London.

Reviews.Title: “absolute **** hole”
Reviews.Author: M_McDonnell15
Reviews.Content: Would advise not to stay here. Absolutely awful. dirty, room smaller than harry potters cupboard, basic breakfast, unhelpful staff. requested to tranfer to another hotel and was tol all booked. asked to see manager but told not available. wrote complaint before staying in the room as so angry. sent numerous emails and faxes but had no response. DO NOT STAY HERE!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “avoid this hellhole at all costs”
Reviews.Author: chris f
Reviews.Content: my room was horrible the shower was only 4 square feet I am thin and found it difficult to shower properly, the water goes everywhere which also explains why the room smells of mold due to the fact the door sil was rotted and there was mold under the carpet . the carpet also was cut apart and pieced together like a puzzle and the restaurant, IF you can call it that is actually in the front lobby of the hotel so you can eat and have someone checking in with their luggage behind your chair at the same time everything about this hotel was a nightmare it should be a 0 Star hotel if they ever had that rating avialable. It seems they are out to make money and do not care about the paying guests at all NO AIR CONDITIONING at all and the single beds were nothing more than a mattress on a folding cot frame this was by far the worst experience I have ever had in London the windows do not open enought o give you good ventilation and the noise from the street and the tightly packed rooms is unbearable. My stay included breakfast which i never used I just wanted to get the hell out of the hotel as early as i could and stay away as long as possible.

Reviews.Title: “Only the location was good.”
Reviews.Author: marie-claude v
Reviews.Content: I was there 9 nights. The luggage storage, if you arrive before check-in or you have a late flight out of London, is 5Â£. The first time I have ever paid for luggage storage, even in youth hostel it is usually free. Then they gave us a room in a very bad shape on the 6th floor. Carpet is old, there are holes in the wall in the bathroom and the shower head can't even stay on the wall hook. And then we learn that internet in the room is only available on the 1rst and 2nd floor rooms. We were moved to the 2nd floor the second day after insisting. The room was even smaller, and the windows don't open in a way to let enough air come in. Internet was incredibly slow, even in the lobby. But worst was the staff. One of them sneered when I complained about the bad internet connection. They will not assist you in the day to day need (like finding a movie theatre). The elevator was was out of order 2 morinings, with people screaming inside to let them out... Overall a very bad experience. The location, however, is fantastic. The only good thing I have to say about that hotel.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT BOOK THIS HOTEL - EVER!!!”
Reviews.Author: 19wendycooper67
Reviews.Content: Have just come off the phone from this hotel who have taken it on themselves to cancel my daughter's reservation this morning BEFORE she had chance to check in! We made the booking on laterooms last Thursday and used a debit card to reserve the room. This card was not being used to pay for it, she was paying cash on arrival. When she arrived she was told that they had already tried to take the money off her card and as it had been declined, her room had been cancelled!!! They then offered her another room at double the price - I THINK NOT!! They say they emailed us yesterday - THEY DID NOT!!! This hotel is operated by a bunch of Scheisters (and they didn't even understand me when I told them this - if they employed staff who spoke english, they would probably have had a chance of doing so!!!!) BE WARNED - DO NOT BOOK THIS HOTEL!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very high price for this quality”
Reviews.Author: persejonh
Reviews.Content: Room was a very small, but it wasnt a problem. London rooms usually always small. It was very hot in rooms and the window could not be fully open. Despite the fact that it was not hot on the street. Reception need of refurbishment. Hotel located near to very good and big supermarket. The tube near too. I would have agreed to live in this hotel again only for 50 pounds, not more!

Reviews.Title: “Not up to my expectations-Samll room-** stars”
Reviews.Author: Giudy98
Reviews.Content: The room was very small. Not much place to open even cabin trolley. Old wool blanket on the bed. Stuck faucet in the bathroom. Anyhow the room was clean. Basic continental breakfast. Old, small and not properly working elevator. Pretty good location. Safe neighbour and 10 minutes walk from Gloucester sq. Underground station. Suggestable only for short stays.

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel, wouldnt pay the rack rate, good if you can get a good price”
Reviews.Author: manibainz
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here 2 times, and have paid between Â£47-Â£60 for a single room, i certainly wouldnt pay the rack rate. Close to Earls Court tube, reception staff are quite rude, whilst I was checking I had to wait 15 mins whilst the receptionist was on the computer. Room was OK, small but clean. I ordered some food in the restuarant and instead of bringing it over to me, she just left in aside and walked of leaving me to get up and get it, VERY RUDE. Cant comment on the breakfast. Would stay again if price was right, but the staff really need some classes on Customer Service, worst service I have experienced.

Reviews.Title: “Not Impressed but it served it's purpose”
Reviews.Author: traveleramanda
Reviews.Content: First, way over priced. I knew things in London would be expensive, but seriously we had a lot of troubles with the bill and it doesn't even include breakfast which is an extra 10 pounds! Frustrating stay from the beginning. Oh and when the fire alarm goes off at 3am as typical in the UK no one really leaves and it seems the staff doesn't really care to do anything about it either. Absolutely no help when this happened. Does have a bar on the ground floor, looked nice. The 3 person room is a king bed and roll away cot-just as a warning. And the rooms are small to begin with. TV, Desk, tea kettle, shower and toilet all in room so that was nice. Bit of a walk from the tube but nice little town that it is located in. Felt safe walking around at all hours. Good restaurants in town too and a TESCO market. Housekeeping staff were nice, front desk not so much.

Reviews.Title: “Very unsatisfactory stay”
Reviews.Author: Jisungpark
Reviews.Content: Really unenjoyable stay. When I arrived into my room I was surprised a how small my room was. My miniscule tv was hidden In a corner drawer so unwatchable. My bathroom was a disgrace as well. You couldn't move inside it if the door was open, the shower head was up to my chest with very little pressure. Each time I showered I flooded the bathroom, the flusher didn't work on my toilet. To add to the misery there was alot of noise each night I stayed there and then the maids start very early chatting out load and crashing into your door meaning very little sleep had. The value of my room was good compared to the other hotels near by but I can see why. I wouldn't recommend this hotel to anyone. Won't be returning!!!

Reviews.Title: “Faulty Towers - will never be back”
Reviews.Author: LeonieE
Reviews.Content: This has to be one of the worst hotels I have stayed in for the price we paid for. The bath in the FIRST room we stayed in was removed to be replaced by a hand held shower and a shower curtain - smelt like damp - so did the room. Furniture scuffed, chipped, no doors on cupboards (cheap fittings), scuffed walls - just shoddy. SECOND ROOM - air conditioner, shower, and bathroom light didnt work - no one came to fix it after noting it on first day - we were there for four days. The safe in the room didnt work, of the 15 safes in reception 7 didnt have doors/keys. Breakfast was a joke - you can have croissant, cold toast, jam, butter,cereal, tea that has been standing in a flask for the whole morning. but if you want cheese for the croissant is 5 pounds more (for a continental breakfast). Oh and the telephone lines in the bedrooms didnt work - the lines were down for three days. The breakfast staff were efficent but certainly not warm and friendly. Location and reception staff great - but overall do not pay full price for this hotel its the pits. What was so interesting is that even after we changed rooms, complained about the second room - NO ONE atteneded to it.

Reviews.Title: “Really good value”
Reviews.Author: susudup
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed for 6 days in a twin room - small, but impeccably clean and absolutely adequate for our needs.......which were to have a safe,clean, comfortable bed to return to after days of shopping and sightseeing - wonderful to be able to make tea/coffee in our room and the front desk staff were generous with extra sachets. The location was lovely - nice part of London with easy access to the tube - and the front desk staff were welcoming and extremely helpful with directions/maps and advice. We were blessed with marvellous weather - which always helps - and on a couple of evenings we were glad to have a fan in the room. We didn't eat in the hotel - so can't make any comment.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel for price and Location”
Reviews.Author: angelina1813
Reviews.Content: I don't know what the hell people are complaining about. I've staid at all types of hotels and this one is perfect. The price was lovely the location even better, and the staff was very kind. The room is a bit smaller than AMERICAN hotels but so are most hotels in Europe. After reading all the reviews we were so worried about the hotel and when we got there they were very accommodating, and the room was very cute. Small but perfect enough for us to sleep in. The Bathrooms tub was huge and so I soaked heavenly in it every night. DO not listen to the other stupid reviews. This place is perfectly located in a good neighborhood with stores and tube stops all around it.... I would definitely stay there again ... Perfect for the budget traveler and it doesn't make you feel like you're on a budget!

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel on earth.”
Reviews.Author: cm1983
Reviews.Content: I am not normally one to use dramatic titles but this place is complete hell. The room was like something out of the 80s and the shower only suitable for people of 4 ft height and slim build. The night manager had the worst attitude I have ever experienced in hospitality. Such a shame to have such a badly thought out hotel in such a beautiful part of London. Avoid at all costs. I will be trying the Premier Inn down the road next time

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: LolloC
Reviews.Content: Before arrival, I was a bit apprehensive, having read other reviews here, but some people were being over-harsh! Yes, the rooms are small, tvs are tiny and a lick of paint wouldn't go astray, but I can't fault this hotel. Brilliant location, close to the tube and walking distance of Kensington, Sainsbury's supermarket across the road. Friendly staff. Very comfortable bed, and the room was bigger than in a 5* hotel I stayed in on a previous trip to London. If you get a good deal, go for it!

Reviews.Title: “It does what it says on the tin”
Reviews.Author: adnerb62
Reviews.Content: Having read some previous reviews of this hotel I was a bit apprehensive travelling here but found it to be just as described. I paid Â£58 per night for a single room but on arrival was given a twin (to book single at hotel is Â£105). I would have been upset if I had paid over Â£100 a night but felt I got what I paid for. The room was clean although the bathroom could do with a lick of paint. Breakfast was a normal continental with juice, tea, coffee, cereals, bread, toast , croissants (lovely and fresh) and preserves. The staff at reception and in the breakfast room were all very friendly and helpful. For what I paid, I really couldn't fault it.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but does the job!”
Reviews.Author: mummymeister
Reviews.Content: I read the other reviews after booking and was very worried! However, the hotel was in a perfect location for me just a few minutes from the tube and near to Earls Court exhibition centre. The check in staff were very welcoming and friendly. There is no doubt that my room was compact. It wasnt the cleanest and the carpet was missing in parts. However, this was half the price of a popular chain hotel and certainly not half the standard! There was a problem with my radiator and maintenance came within 10 mins and fixed it. There were a lot of students staying and they were a bit noisy but not so as I lost any sleep. I could pick holes in things but really for me it did the job -somewhere just to sleep and get up and go in the morning. Other reviewers with more negative comments clearly want a Champagne hotel on Lemonade money - sorry these places don't exist. The other real minus point was the cooked breakfast. At Â£10 it was appalling value for money - 1 button mushroom, is this a portion!! Take the continental or go down to Earls Court and take your pick.

Reviews.Title: “Good enough, but not at the rack rate”
Reviews.Author: SuefromSydney
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights and had a good late booking rate, varying form 49 to 79 GBP a night for a twin room. Ours was on the top floor facing south with a nice view of the church opposite. We are NOT tall; a low beam and a sloping ceiling in part of the room would be a problem for some. The bathroom was better than some, and big enough, with shower over bath. Beds OK, the linen was old but clean, as was the room and bathroom. Staff were busy, but helpful enough. We did not need anything special, though. Bought the GBP5 continental breakfast once. It is OK, but much nicer coffee and food at local cafes. Easy enough walk from Earls Court or Gloucester Road tubes. Fairly quiet, being one block from Cromwell Road. Heating was not on until about 4pm, although the weather was cold (below 10C). Also no free wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location. Clean Accomodation”
Reviews.Author: clairzi2
Reviews.Content: Wow! People really do come on here to moan about pettyness that isn't overly relevant. Not enough people come on here and say good things! I was dreading staying here after what EVERYONE was writing, but actually i had an excellent stay. This hotel is in a fantastic location literally 5 minutes walk from earls court underground. The room is yes standard, but it is clean and comfy. Wouldnt recommend staying for longer than a nights over stay though. Reasons being the bathroom is ridicously small. Also the heating must be on full all night because its roasting constantly, we had to sleep with the window open all night to actually breathe! We didn't have the breakfast, when we arrived late evening we headed up to the sainsburys at the end of the road and bought some fruit and breakfast bars and we had those in the morning which was fine for us. But there is plenty of places to eat (morning-evening) on Cromwell Road which is literally just around the corner. I thought this hotel was perfect for and overnight stay in a perfect location, not near all the hustle and bustle of London. The prices were extremly reasonable too.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Accomodations-Great Location”
Reviews.Author: PilotTravler
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival was given a non-smoking room as requested that wreaked of smoke. Front desk reluctantly offered another room. The staff was working on a ceiling leak in the breakfast area the first day. Mattresses and garbage were stored in the already cramped hallways. On the last day of our stay we awoke to the sound of water dripping in the bathroom. A few minutes later water was pouring out of the ceiling from the floor above. Front desk was contacted and said they would eventually send maintenance up. The leaking continued for the rest of our stay making everything wet. The room wreaked of mold that was obviously recently painted over. When checking out staff didn't even apologize for the water leak and said they would tell maintenance to eventually have a look. No compensation or even a simply apology. The only thing good to say is this hotel is close to tube stations and food. Otherwise if you stay here you can probably bet you will get a free shower when you least expect it.

Reviews.Title: “Tired and tatty”
Reviews.Author: nbl50
Reviews.Content: Assumed from Web that this was a business hotel. The overall standards were very poor. My single room was very tired (hadn't been painted for years) and the tatty en-suite was murky and very tiny (door hit toilet on opening). Additional cosy of breakfast (Â£7.50) was not good value. East Euro staff were pleasant and always has a smile. I booked this hotel as it was at a special price - after a few minutes I could see why!

Reviews.Title: “This is a hotel?!”
Reviews.Author: iStormVR
Reviews.Content: The service was terrible, the staff lousy and the communication lousy. Ordered for me by the company I was working for, with a breakfast service. None of the staff would believe breakfast was on the order on the night I checked in, when finally we sorted that, the staff phoned to confirm and apologise, when I went for breakfast they again had no record of it. Room was rtying and uncomfortable, with terrible decor, a six year old would have done a better painting job, tiny showers, half torn upholstery on the lian dining chair in the room, oh, and English is their second language here, so dont expect to understand them, or vice versa

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting”
Reviews.Author: lcdjws
Reviews.Content: We were on a holiday of a lifetime having never been out of Australia. We went to Rome, Venice, Florence, Nice, Paris, Dover and then to London & the Ambassadors where we were to stay for 7 nights. My wife took one look at the room (212) and burst into tears. Wall to wall beds and not even a chair in the room. I requested to be moved, otherwise we were out of there and they moved us level 6 which was stiffling,and also told us that we could have one of the new airconditioned rooms in the basement the following day which we unfortunately agreed to. The smell in the basement rooms was something terrible. Outside our window was a "courtyard" full of stagnant water which was there for 3 days before it was cleared, and again wall to wall beds. This hotel is not recommended

Reviews.Title: “You can do a lot better”
Reviews.Author: Embir
Reviews.Content: Like others I got one of the dreaded basement rooms. I'm over 6 foot and my head was touching the ceiling in half the room. When I asked to be relocated to a larger room (and was willing to pay more) they moved me to the first floor - higher ceilings but actually an even smaller room. Im no stranger to European hotels and am ok with tight space but this was beyond the pale. You literally sat on the bed to use the "desk" and I couldn't lay my suitcase flat and open the door. It was the smallest hotel room i have ever seen. I checked out day two of a five night stay. Despite the fact that i told them they day before I left they charged an extra night penalty because I hadn't told them "24 hours in advance" which of course I couldn't do because they hadnt yet moved me to the shoebox. I would never go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Bad hotel room”
Reviews.Author: uhamdani
Reviews.Content: Negatives: Window shade is permanently broken [won't open] and when reported , it wasn't fixed right, it remained broken. Repair card not picked up by maid. Poor lighting. Room too small, only about 15 cm from one side of double bed to the heater, so I had to climb to bed from one end. About 30 cm from other side of bed to wall. No room to move when 2 suit cases are on floor. Rubbish bin not emptied. No soap was supplied by maid, so had to get down to front office to get one. No writing paper in room. Maid appeared not to read instructions left on desk. Hotel is not a 3 star, not by North American standard anyway. Positives: Reception staff is courteous and efficient. Continental breakfast acceptable. Good bathroom with good quality tissue paper. Location is good, close to Cromwell Rd for buses and convenient to Gloucester Rd tube and Earls Court tube stations.

Reviews.Title: “Very BAD experience - outrageous price”
Reviews.Author: bdlCopenhagen
Reviews.Content: It was a VERY BAD experience to stay at this hotel. When arriving - we got a room in the basement - the size of a closet eventhough we were 3 persons. The room had NO WINDOWS and there wasn't enough hot water for 3 people to take a shower. Nothing in this room was even close to the pictures we saw on the hotel web site and on www.booking.com (where we booked). And the price was outrageous - GBP 120,00 per night without breakfast. The room was not at all suitable for human beings to stay. After complaining - we were moved to another room. It had a window - yes - but it couldn't open (it was broken). The heat was on maximum during the whole stay and the toilet couldn't flush. And everything was dirty with leftovers from other guests underneath the beds etc.. Still for the price of GBP 120,00 per night. I would not ever recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Crappy hotel with poor service - will never go back”
Reviews.Author: wullumt
Reviews.Content: Our room with 3 separate beds was clearly an ordinary single stuffed with two extra beds. Which overcrowded the room completely! No space left whatsoever - the beds were so close it actually felt like one giant bed... Making a complaint at the front desk lead nowhere. The arrogant receptionist would not even try to find a solution for us. Upgrade not possible. Change hotel not possible....And no compensation offered. Central heating was on, which made it very warm in the room, my guess 25-27 degrees. We asked the same receptionist if the heat could be turned down or off, which he declined to do. He explained that it would shut down automaticly in just a few hours. Which of course was a complete lie. It was on all night.... Bathroom and shower also very small.

Reviews.Title: “Unpleasant and unhelpful staff and room very very small and disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Melbeeireland
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights. On arrival, staff at reception were quite indifferent and unwelcoming. Our room was tiny, barely fitted 2 single beds almost stuck together. Broken blind on window and no curtains. Window looked out on to a roof with boiler pipes. Badly in need of refurbishment, carpets in bedroom poor, blankets also were quite 'past their day'. Bathroom also very small and paintwork on door chipped. No facility to leave our cases on day of departure so had to pay 8 pounds for each case at Victoria station for the day.

Reviews.Title: “Cold, damp, moldy room”
Reviews.Author: processofelimination
Reviews.Content: I could not believe that any hotel would be as bad as the reports I had read but fellow travelers were right. Rough old blankets, stained carpets, black mold, rude staff... The hotel had turned off the heating, claiming it was 'summer' (May), so the room and beds were icy cold and the beds were so damp they were nearly wet. This tiny room was on an upper floor. We complained to the front desk and the man became hostile, told us he 'had heard it all before' and didn't want to hear it again. We did not use the room but the hotel still charged us for two nights! Awful place run by awful people. I have stayed in student housing, youth hostels and campsites but have never seen anything like this.

Reviews.Title: “Pay first - never return!”
Reviews.Author: lili_Eu
Reviews.Content: I booked the Ambassadors because of the good location but that was the one and only positive. On arrival reception wanted me to pay for the stay before having seen the room at all. When I suggested they can authorize my card but not take the money she offered me to have a look and even offered two rooms. The first one was freshly painted and brand new furniture that would have been great, except that it was in the basement and had no window at all, the air coming through a ventillator. Felt exactly like a rathole, so I refused. The second room shown was on the fifth floor with a window but very tiny and totally filled up with three beds, although I was alone and originally booked a double bed room (no single available). The bathroom was so small that you can't open the door before it bumps into the washbasin. Anybody over 160cm would have to pull his or her head down to squeeze into the shower. But I had no choice so stayed overnight here. The bed was very short and felt like sitting on a camel but at least was not very noisy on the top floor. Next morning I wanted to have breakfast so went downstairs but got totally frustrated when the doorman told me to pay cash for the breakfast before having taken it. I asked if he ever paid in a restaurant before having eaten but they referred to the management decision and that was it. So i rather returned to my room for my vallet and went outside to have a very nice and cheap breakfast in a nearby cafÃ©. When I returned to pack my things I got totally angry because the cleaning lady - who did not speak a word of English - was doing my room with my things obviously still in the room, one hour before check-out time. So I had more than enough of this hotel already that was finally crowned by reception taking twenty minutes to produce an invoice - although they made me pay already the night before. When i asked for the name of the Hotel manager the receptionist wrote me his first name and could not produce a card to spell it properly. I definitely do not recommend for anybody to stay in this hotel, the worst service ever in London.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Terrible”
Reviews.Author: kneesha84
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 4 nights in July as a part of our honeymoon. To make a very long story short it was very eventful and mostly terrible. Our first room caused both of our allergies to act up. There was mold all over the ceiling in the bathroom, we couldn't fit our suitcases in the room without having to climb over them and the tv was totally shot. The next day we were able to get a much nicer room - the staff member actually called whoever knew what rooms were available and asked if they had any "of the nice double rooms available" The newer room was much nicer although the power went out every night whenever we or someone else tried to make tea. The breakfast was very carb heavy. There was a cooked breakfast but we didn't have it and I didn't see anyone. There was no air conditioning, the lift was extremely sluggish. else eating it so i can't comment on that. On a more positive note, the location was excellent, a close walk to Earl Court and Piccadilly lines and a nice walk along the way. Most of the staff we dealt with handled our concerns well and we appreciated that. I wouldn't reccommend it at all however.

Reviews.Title: “poor customer service”
Reviews.Author: ikalala
Reviews.Content: Good location, somewhat clean, reasonable price by London standards , but you certainly get what you pay for. The bed took up almost the entire room with barely enough room to maneuver around it. The front desk staff were not very clear on offering directions in the neighborhood. One staff member was even somewhat rude. Was quoted an incorrect flat rate price by them for the taxi service to Gatwick. At the airport the driver said the price was 102 pounds not 87. After the driver made a few phone calls he acknowledged the hotel misquoted the price and accepted the 87 pounds, but he was certainly angry with the hotel staff. If you decide to stay at this hotel, do your own homework for directions and taxi service because the staff are not dependable.

Reviews.Title: “I'd Rather Sleep in a Tent...Over Priced, Not Clean, and Poor Service.”
Reviews.Author: rphilli9
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel througha travel agent. That was a mistake. I coould have done better on my own. Also, remember England uses the British Pound for currency, not the Euro like the other countries in Europe. Flew in from Paris, France. Took taxi to hotel in evening. Outside appearance of hotel and location was nice. Front desk people were friendly, but not very helpful or knowledgable. Floors in hallway were very scuffed up and not maintained properly. Room was terrrible. Bathroom was clean, but toliet didn't flush well. The door hinge was broken and repaired poorly. Looked as if someone had tried to break into the room and kicked off the hinge. The room had 2 cots put together which was our "queen sized bed". The bedding was worn out and looked "skecthy". The t.v. had only 2-3 channels and it was a small t.v, like a 12 inch that you'd buy for your kitchen, etc. There was about 12 inches of space to walk around the bed. The bed took-up most of the room. Needless to say my wife was in tears, and I woke up with bug bites around my ankles. Not sure if they were bedbugs, or, fleas. I used anit-biotic onimnet for the rest of my trip. Going to check with my docoter in the states this week. Had to spray out my travel bags and wash all clothing when we got back to the states. Don't waste your money on the Ambassador Hotel. We left the next night and stayed at the Kensington/ London Marriott for our remainig 4 nights. The Marriott was clean, good location, and staff was friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Utterly the worst hotel ever!”
Reviews.Author: dodongbadong
Reviews.Content: Magnetic card doesnt work! The room is too freaking small! The smallest tv ive ever seen! Windows doesn't open! You cannot see a thing on the windows due net! Heater cannot be turned off! Thin walls in which case you can hear the other guest in the next room! Street noise is absurd! Conclusion: Room pictures are deceiving! Not worth it!

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel I've been to!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Tony189158
Reviews.Content: Terrible rooms - small,hot, windows cannot be opened; smell of grease; cold and disgusting breakfast; frozen and probably out of date food in the bar... crashed huge bug in the bathroom! On the website it is completely different -just a big lie! Expensive Wi-Fi Never ever again!

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: Xerxenia
Reviews.Content: The room was very small yet clean and for an English hotel surprisingly quiet. Only the curtains could have been better - they would not go over the full width of the window. There's no minibar in the room, but a small fridge at the reception desk is at guests' disposal to store some things. Perfect location only 200m from 2 tube stations (Piccadilly, Circle & District line) and walking distance from Hyde Park. A Sainsbury, Waitrose and CafÃ©s are round the corner. Booked directly on the hotel's site, and at Â£45 per night, excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Nice neighborhood, rude staff, small outdated dirty rooms”
Reviews.Author: rahafc
Reviews.Content: 2 girlfriends and I were in town for 4 days, 3 nights. Beware that 3 star in London or the rest of the UK is not the same as 3 stars in the U.S. We knew this going in, however we were still disappointed. We had a triple room, and just wanted it for a place to sleep and shower. It's small, like all rooms in London, and outdated decor. Those things I can deal with. The bugs on the window sill that were there on arrival and never cleaned throughout our stay is another matter. The toilets would not flush completely, and there was mold in the heater next to the window that caused our allergies to go ballistic. Staff knocked on our door at 11:10 a.m. the last day of our stay when we were gathering our bags to check out, and said in a threatening manner, "check out is at 11, and you need to leave NOW!" They also refused to print a confirmation for our travel plans, saying they did not have a printer, which we know wasn't true. The bar is unaccomodating and the front desk staff is unhelpful. You have to buy a drink to use the Internet kiosks, but aren't told it is for 30 consecutive minutes. I logged off after 10 minutes thinking I could save my time for later in the evening. When I returned in an hour, the bartender said there was nothing she could do to help. The doors in the hallway slam loudly at all hours of the night, and I heard my next door neighbors doing their thing very clearly. It's not a loud location per se, it's just that the rooms don't have a lot of privacy and you can hear people in the hallway or other rooms. I even heard the throat clearing of the guy in the shower next door. They are also not air conditioned like most of London, and it's hot and uncomfortable at times. Overall, the bad reviews are true, but it was just a place to sleep and shower. It's location is good. 5-7 minute walk to Gloucester Road underground stop, which is right on the circle line. Also, there is a grocery store and many restaurant options nearby. I just think you get what you pay for, and this place is cheap for London and comparable to other hotels in its star class. You don't get a nice place for that price. It's just too bad the staff is so rude. As Americans, we have to be extra nice to represent our country well abroad, but the Ambassadors hotel does not return the favor to represent London well. I'd go on Priceline if I had it to do over again. Book a 4 star for 150 GBP. You'll be much happier.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Mona31
Reviews.Content: we had a wonderful time in london-our 3rd trip! first one with sisters and trips 2 and 3 with children. this was the best choice of accommodation and we will be returning to the ambassadors hotel on our next visit. the location is perfect for visits to the natural history museum, V&A and science museum. For everything else, earls court tube station is just a few minutes walk away. the staff were lovely and breakfast was more than adequate. icing on the cake was that when my son left his nintendo ds behind, the hotel kindly posted it to us in Ireland. Need I say more? thank you ambassadors!

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: db0805
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel and have regreated it ever since. Still have nightmares of folding back the sheets on my bed and seeing the BIGGEST roach I have ever seen. Needless to say I slept with the lights on that night. I cried all night because of the conditions and the thought of having to live with then for an addition 8 nights. The other room had such a smell to it and mold all over the baseboards that the individual had a horrible asmath attack and refused to use the shower in that room. Front desk agreed to move me to another room but refused to relocate the other individual. Person in elevator stated they had silver fish in their tub. Please spend your hard earned money on a different hotel so that you can enjoy your London experience.

Reviews.Title: “Don't be fooled by the nasty reviews”
Reviews.Author: headwingnut
Reviews.Content: I was the group leader for 19 students and parents on a trip to London recently. I selected the Ambassadors Hotel from a wide range of offerings and did so based on location and price. The location is excellent: 5-7 minute walk from Gloucester Rd tube station. Are the rooms small? Yes. I had a single and there was room for a small wardrobe and desk, with a luggage rack at the end of the twin bed. It probably would have been easier to soap the walls of the shower and simply turn around than scrub down without pushing out the curtain. However, most tourists traveling to London are not doing so to spend lots of time in the hotel room. We certainly didn't. The rooms were clean, the bed comfortable, the staff very friendly and helpful. It became very apparent to me that the majority of nasty reviews on this site were coming from people who do not understand the cost of London and thought they were getting a five star hotel for a three star price. If you need a good location and place to get a good night's sleep, then do consider this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “It was ok”
Reviews.Author: Katja890
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel with my boyfriend for a couple of days. + The location is in a safe neighbourhood with nearby a large supermarket (Sainburies), tube station and serveral shops and pubs. So that's a plus. + The staff was friendly; when our air condition broke down, they've repaired it straight away. + the entrance hall looked welcoming + In contrary to other reviews, the state of the furniture and walls were fine. The room was cleaned every day. - The room itself, however, was rather small. But then again, British hotelrooms do not have the best reputation. - The heating was for some reason stuck at the highest level, so it was boiling! Luckily there was an airconditioning in the room. - The TV was disapointingly small. Our visit wasn't too bad, though we only stayed in the hotel to sleep and eat. For adolescents like us, I'd recemmond the hotel. Though I wouldn't see my parents staying over in this hotel; they'd prefere something more luxurious. Katja (19, Netherlands)

Reviews.Title: “I wouldn't stay in this hotel even if it was free.”
Reviews.Author: normandgreg
Reviews.Content: Stupidly I didn't check out the reviews before booking this hotel, I wish i did. Was given a double room in the basement, bathroom with mouldy walls and ceiling, rusty shower rail, no heating in bathroom, plugs off the wall in the bedroom, metal framed cheap beds. The room was very small, and had a central heating boiler next to room - could hear it all night. Friend had second floor single room - had to climb over the bed to get to the other side of the room, lights didn't work - AWFUL. basically I would NOT recommend staying here even if it was cheap. I wouldn't stay in this hotel even if it was free.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't even stay the night.”
Reviews.Author: MJBL
Reviews.Content: Horrible hotel, should be classed as hostel. We were given a room on 6th floor (attic room). It was tiny and the beds weren't clean. We had a small portable tv which was blurred so it was impossible to watch. Would not recommend. We left and booked into another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “One of the Worst Hotels EVER!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: MrsSDunstable
Reviews.Content: I'm really not exaggerating, this is the worst hotel I've ever stayed at. Horrible room, terrible service and over-priced. The bed was disgusting, we checked in and I had to call the desk for new sheets and extra blankets, ones that didn't have suspicious stains all over them. I assumed a 3*, whilst not maybe the best, but would be reasonable in terms of cleanliness and service. This so-called 3* hotel made all the other 3* places I've stayed at look like palaces. Breakfast was a part of the deal and the next morning we went down at 9am (breakfast was from 7 - 11am) to be told that all the hot food had gone and we could have some fruit if we wanted. Thank you very much, how terribly generous of you! They weren't even apologetic or embarrassed for having not just us but many other guests who had paid for breakfast as part of the deal go without any. They didn't have the courtesy to offer vouchers to local eateries, which would've been a nice gesture. Anyway, to anyone who is thinking about staying here, please don't. For the prices this place charges you could stay in a nice b&b or many of the other 100% better 3* hotels in London. This might sounds like a harsh review but honestly, I wouldn't want anyone's visit to London to be soured by staying in an appalling place like this!

Reviews.Title: “Very Small Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Fifer_8
Reviews.Content: Fairly conveniently placed for underground connections to most of tourist attractions. Check-in was friendly and efficient and reception staff generally pleasant and helpful. Similarly, waiting staff in the Breakfast Room were hard working and attentive. All very positive so far, Unfortunately the rooms are very small, and I do mean small! In our room there was a king-sized bed which left little room for anything else, not even a chair. If you wanted to sit down, there was only the bed. The bathroom was also very small. There was a TV in the room but reception was so poor as to make it unusable. The walls between rooms were paper thin-or appeared to be-as we could hear the conversation quite clearly from the room next us. The hotel was spotlessly clean overall and we had no complaints on that score. Breakfast was more than adequate with a reasonable range of dishes. The published "rack rate" was Â£135 for a double and I don't believe it is value for money at that level. I have stayed in much worse hotels but none with smaller rooms-even in Tokyo.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and location , fine for a short stay.”
Reviews.Author: Thakehams
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night following a concert at the RAH. Nearly went for something more expensive on the basis of some of the shocking reviews here but were glad we didn't. Yes, the room was small and the decor tired but the bathroom was clean , the shower hot and the sheets clean. The location was great, an easy, safe walk from the RAH with a selection of restaurants nearby. We didn't have the breakfast but there is a large Sainsburys nearby (with a Starbucks) that can fulfil most needs. For Â£65 a night in this part of the world we thought this good value although a stay of more than one night may have been pushing things.

Reviews.Title: “dont stay there!”
Reviews.Author: UkFlygirl
Reviews.Content: the hotel was a big disappointment, i greatly regretted staying there. the room was in a bad state, it was freezing cold but they would not turn on central heating till november! there was a breeze coming in through the window, it was like camping in a small room. thank god they gave me a wool blanket so i wouldnt be as cold. unfriendly "room service" if you want to call it that, rusty bathroom, no food or snacks available, only breakfast for 5 pound which is a ridiculous price for some toast and orange cordial. i would never go back there, sorry.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Everything else terrible”
Reviews.Author: lostparadisee
Reviews.Content: First of all, this hotel is in a very nice and quite area, not too far from Hyde Park, near Earls Cross underground. By tube its only 3 stops to Covent Garden and its has not far some restaurants and pubs. And from outside the hotel doesn't look too bad. Ok, this is the nice part. Then comes the rest: my bedroom was in a basement (a lot of rooms are in the basement) were there is a awful smell of gas. The bedroom was tiny (we couldnt walk straight because there were practically no space between the bed and the wall), the sheets were too old, there was a cockroach in the bathroom. I dont ask much in a hotel but this one was bellow standarts.... Most of all, the staff was very rude and everything we had to pay in advance (room, breakfast and so on). They could not charge in the room altought they pre-autorized 20Â£ charge in my credit card so if i didnt pay anything (who it was impossible because, as i sad, payed everything in advance including the 4 nights i stayed there). One night we arrived about 00h00 and the key didnt work. There was no one in the reception. We looked and found a girl in the kitchen. When we ask her to solve the problem or go get the clerk she stood there and sad that she couldnt do that because she had no autorization. Well, we had to wait about half hour before the clerk arrived... In conclusion, dont go to this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Better than the reviews led me to fear”
Reviews.Author: richardygk
Reviews.Content: We stayed from September 6 to September 12. The hotel was booked in conjunction with our Air Canada flights. I was a bit worried from what I'd read in the reviews, but we were able to check in early without any difficulty. Our room was on the third floor near the small lift. It won't fit more than two people with luggage but it got us to the third floor every time. The room reminded us of a university residence with an ensuite. The bedding and towels were clean, the shower had good pressure and the temperature was good. My companion asked for a second blanket and one was delivered. Breakfast was fine with toast, cereal, buns and croissants. Plenty of jam. The spread wasn't as extensive as an all-inclusive, but the price was much less. Staff were friendly and helpful, although many had limited English. We did not visit the bar so can't comment. If you are in need of a clean bed in a great location, this hotel is an excellent choice. The location is roughly half-way between the Earl's Court and Gloucester Road tube stations. If you are coming from Heathrow, alight at Earl's Court and use the lift.

Reviews.Title: “Poor! Choose a travelodge instead!”
Reviews.Author: CAFCDarren
Reviews.Content: Even for what we paid at supposedly 50% off this was poor value for money. The shoebox of a room consisted of a bed and 1 foot leg room around the bed. The bathroom was basic, dated and poorly constructed. The check-in was fine, after that it went downhill rapidly. The main lift didn't work, hadn't for sometime apparently, so you had the stairs or service lift, which could fit a maximum of 3 people, and you had to share with the dirty linen and staff that could not speak any English. The way it clunked its way up the through the floors had you offering prayers on a safe arrival at your floor! The bed linen was pretty non existant, and appeared to have been in use since the war! No duvets here, just a sheet and tatty blanket. The night time entertainment consisted of pornographic type soundtracks eminnating from a room a few doors down. At least he seemed to be enjoying his stay!! The breakfast was very poor. A stale croissant and toast, though there was no toast left! Oh yes don't forget the cornflakes! For an extra Â£2.50 you can upgrade to a cooked English Breakfast. based on the continental we didn't bother! McDonalds is just around the corner! For a few extra quid you can stay in a travel lodge type establishment - it would be money well spent! Whats good - great location for Earls Court - there are plenty of other hotels in the area you'll be pleased to know.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Horrible - Don't Go There!!!”
Reviews.Author: sherv
Reviews.Content: Room tiny and dirty. . Staff uninterested and unhelpful. Breakfast disgusting. Doesn't deserve any stars.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, central, accessible, close to a good selection of restaurants & facilities”
Reviews.Author: MrPipEdinburgh
Reviews.Content: Helpful staff, clean with comfortable room/bathroom. Shower temperature stable with power, towels adequate with shower/shampoo sachets & soap provided. Tea, Coffee, Sugar & milk tubes (sometimes a challenge to open) gave refreshment. TV channels provided the basic 5 with reliability. Noisy guests returning later in the evening posed an irritation but it was momentary. Air Conditioning was provided & both silent & operational During our last visit the lift was being maintained & therefore out of use - we were in the basement with only one flight of stairs to negotiate. Breakfast was simple but enjoyable - we kept to the basic 'Continental' option with a more than adequate supply of croissants, butter, jam, marmalade, cereal options, milk, coffee, tea, orange juice etc. - you can inexpensively upgrade to 'Full English' if you wish. The Bar was well provisioned, a discount voucher provided for your first round, spending over Â£4 gained 30 minutes use of the hotels computer network. Staff were friendly & helpful, room service left our room re-provisioned & neat & tidy. All in all this is the 4th time I have used this hotel - it provides a reliable, clean & easily accessible hub for Earls Court & surrounds

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as expected”
Reviews.Author: Solros15
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews here I thought I was going to spend four nights in a dump. It was really not that bad!! The single room I was staying in and the doubleroom my friends were staying in were tiny, but all you do is sleep there so it doesn't matter. The room was clean, which is the most important thing. The location was super, only a five minute walk from Gloucester road underground station. It is definitely not the best hotel I have stayed at but it is not the worst either. I don't think I would recommend it to a friend, but I would tell my friend it is not as bad as the Trip Advisor reviews makes it sound like.

Reviews.Title: “STAY AWAY”
Reviews.Author: j4red
Reviews.Content: Okay I got to this hotel 2 hours before check-in so I left my baggage with them in their security room. Thing about it though, it's not locked, anyone can go in there. Anyways I checked in and I went to my room. The hallways were very small and I had to go through a fire door to get to my room which was not very convenient with all my luggage. I then go into my room and first thing I notice was the size. Very small barely any room to walk. Supposed to get 2 double beds instead got 2 single cots pushed together. The "colour" television only had 5 channels which only 3 had actual colour. Bathroom was not bad despite a hair I found but very small. At night it sounded like i was sleeping in the hallway, I could hear every door shut and close and I could hear people talking, showering and even brushing their teeth. Also our phone didn't work and it was very fixed. No fridge, microwave nothing. The customer service was horrible because I always got stuck with the same guy who was no help at all. Finally I got a room switch. The room was bigger, had bigger beds, bigger windows but it still wasn't great. The shower curtains didn't close all the way so water would go all over the place. Not to mention when I originally went to the room there were guys in it fixing it. The location isn't bad because it has very good restaurants around it plus an internet cafe which was excellent and had dirt cheap phone calls to Canada (5 pence a minute). Luckily there was a tube station 3 or so blocks down. The internet at the hotel was 12 pounds for 24 hours and not to mention anyone could access it unless your on your laptop. I got a late checkout because of the time of my flight. I had 2pm as a checkout time but at 1:30pm I was rudely interrupted by room service complaining they had to go home at 2. Not my fault. The man at the front desk actually called my house in Canada telling me if I wasn't out of there he was going to charge me 180 pounds. Bad stay. Don't go there.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible experience”
Reviews.Author: vikabresp
Reviews.Content: Really terrible! We had all the "adventures" possible!!! A screaming client during the night (and the staff haven't made much to help), 1 hour locked in the elevator (that was broken before), a bug in the room, the window didn't opened weel (it was blocked), the room was very hot, the shower didn't worked well, the door was jammed (so we needed to pull and push very hard) the TV wasn't working well, the water heather wasn't working at all, the service was poor.... anyway, if you have a choice, don't go there!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible service”
Reviews.Author: Vinka
Reviews.Content: Hotel is overrated. Service is terrible. Rooms are small, with dirty walls, and dirty carpets. If you need help than the hotel stuff wont be of help. They are very rude and nervous. Only good thing is location.Hotel is located in Kensigton aria.

Reviews.Title: “The WORST hotel I've ever stayed in!!!”
Reviews.Author: MBABCanada
Reviews.Content: Oh boy, where to start...This piece of [--] hotel should be condemned and closed down. Never, ever have I ever had such an awful experience at a hotel. I was there with my 14 year old son and if this hotel hadn't already been paid for through my vacation package, I would of checked out immediately after seeing our "double room" which consisted of two twin cots pushed together without enough space to make them seperate beds. I was with my 14 year old son for goodness sake. I tried calling down to the front desk only to find out that our phone didn't work. I went down to the front desk to ask for a larger room with beds that didn't physically touch and also had a working phone only to be told that they were fully booked and I would have to wait until the next day. During this time, there was a problem with part of my vacation and I NEEDED a telephone. Since the phone in our room wasn't working, I asked if they could dial a local number for me from the house phone in the lobby. Nooooo, that phone only RECEIVES calls. So I asked where a payphone was only to be dismissed with a wave of a hand. I asked for change for the payphone...NOOOOOO they can't provide change for the payphone either. Finally, in tears from frustration, I demanded to know where exactly the payphone was and was given the answer of "on Cromwell Road". Beautiful. Reluctantly somebody finally dialled the number I needed (on the house phone that only RECEIVES calls) and I was able to make my call. The next day, I came down and asked if they had another room ready for me. Nope. Needless to say, it took 4 days before they changed our room. It was slightly larger, and at least there was some space between the beds. However, there was a massive ball of thread or yarn or something in the corner of the room when we checked in. Not a big deal but I decided to leave it there to see how long before it was noticed or cleaned up. Needless to say, it was still there when we checked out. Housekeeping consisted of them coming in and making the beds and folding the towels. Not once was anything actually CLEANED. I wouldn't stay in this [--] again if you paid me. The front desk guy is the rudest, meanest, [--] I've ever met. I requested a late checkout til 2 pm and they told me no problem. Just call down in the morning to remind us. I said okay. I called in the a.m. to remind them of the arrangement I had made the night before for a checkout of 2 p.m. "No problem" I was told. So the day of checkout, my son and I are out and about doing our last minute London things. We get back to the hotel at 1:15 to a yelling front desk clerk. He said he's been trying to call my room and there has been no answer. No [--] sherlock, we're just getting back. He is absolutely livid that I was supposed to be gone at 11 and I'm still there and if I don't check out they are charging me 135 pounds. I told him I had an arrangement (with him of all fricking people) to check out late. Anyway, he rants and raves for awhile. I go upstairs to finish packing and now it's housekeeping banging on my door telling me to get out. OMFG!!! These people are whacked!!! So I finally get everything packed and we're downstairs in the lobby by 1:30. Mr. Personality at the front desk is still ranting and raving. I told him that obviously there was a miscommunication and that I was out in plenty of time for housekeeping to "clean" the room. He did not charge me 135 pounds (but even if he did, I would have disputed the transaction with my credit card company). And get this, I get back home to Canada the next day and there is a message on my answering machine from the nutjob at the front desk telling me if I'm not out of the hotel by 2 pm they are charging me 135 pounds. Now seriously, what are the fricking chances that I'm actually going to receive a message left for me in Canada when I'm in LONDON!!! I would never, ever, in a million years recommend this hotel to anybody, not even my worst enemy. Stay away families, stay away couples, stay away elderly travellers, stay away students, stay away anybody from anywhere!!!

Reviews.Title: “Awful awful place, worst hotel ever stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: Scrufty30
Reviews.Content: Booked this a week before our visit through lastminute.com. Hotel website describes refurbished rooms and believe me, they must have had a very good photographer to make the place look something it isn't. We arrived after lunch and they hadn't allocated us a room. They then tried to put us in a twin despite having a print out that confirmed we had booked a double. They placed us in a corner room on the 5th floor which according to the receptionist was a "lovely nice room". It was absolutely boiling hot, with no aircon and only one of the two windows opened. The room was an absolute disgrace, it's only saving grace was the clean bathroom. They had pushed together two single beds, and there was a gap of about one and a half feet to squeeze round the bed. The sheets were clean, just, but the scabby old blanket on the bed left a lot to be desired. To say I was quite possibley scared of touching said blanket is an understatement. It is quite obvious, unless the other rooms are as bad, that they have kept a few un-refurbished rooms for lastminute.com customers who aren't paying "full whack". We didn't even bother with breakfast. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone, unless you really don't care about where you stay and only want a roof over your head for the night.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for Earl's Court - very basic”
Reviews.Author: jntms
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a friend when we visited London to go to the Brits in Earls Court. The hotel was ideally placed for this, and was close to the bars in Earl's Court. Our room was booked a day or so before we were travelling, and was quite inexpensive at about Â£30 per person. We had a twin room but it was very small, with the beds close up next to one another, and very little space. Ensuite bathroom was tiny but fit for purpose. Only real complaint would be that the room was boiling hot, and there were no windows which could be opened. English Breakfast was included but this was very basic and wasn't to our taste - we headed for a local coffee shop instead. All in all cheap and cheerful, but great location.

Reviews.Title: “Looks better from the outside!”
Reviews.Author: RossoCol
Reviews.Content: Had the mis-fortune to stay at the Ambassadors for 1 night on Tuesday 28th April, booking through Lastminute.com . The room we stayed in was very small, run down and dirty. The bed linen appeared to be old and dirty and needed to be thrown away rather than changed! The bathroom was extremely dirty with paint peeling off the walls and dirt and rust hanging off the radiator. The cooked breakfast was thrown at us and was poor quality although there was plenty of toast and croissants to fill up on. This stay cost Â£61.00 for 2 people so for London it was quite cheap but I certainly wouldn't want to stay more than 1 night. We definitely won't be staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “location good-value poor-single room at double price”
Reviews.Author: Gelling
Reviews.Content: The pictures on the website are nothing like the hotel. Our single room masqueraded as a double. We booked a twin and got a room with a double bed and nothing else. There was no room to walk round the bed-jammed against the window. The shower leaked all over the floor. The blankets needed cleaning. No staff spoke at breakfast, very few seemed to speak english. Cooked breakfast resulted in the same breakfast being placed in front of everyone, including the vegetarian, no toast available. Visitors who asked for a cot were told, no cots availalbe. Complain in the morning to the manager. The morning receptionist was very helpful. More like a hostel than a hotel, definitely not 3 star. Definitely the worst hotel we have ever stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Much better than expected”
Reviews.Author: Metteben
Reviews.Content: I have recently read most of the reviews of the Ambassadors Hotel and my expectations were very low after that. However when we arrived it turned out to be really very good. It was clean, the service friendly, the breakfast (cooked) good. I agree that the rooms are a bit on the small side but on the other hand, the bed was enormous. No mould or dirt as described in other reviews. The rooms were made up very nicely every day. We all agreed, we would certainly come back another time

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Service, mouldy walls, insects!”
Reviews.Author: getawayIreland
Reviews.Content: Where do I start??? My Mum had booked a triple room 2 weeks before arrival on rooms.com and we arrived with the confirmation sheet that the room was booked and paid for. We were told there was no such booking! We waited close to an hour before it was sorted. We were offered 3 single rooms which we did not want. We were not even offered a cup of tea while we waited! Eventually got the room which meant some other visitors would have the same hassle later that evening. The receptionist had not got a clue and never once apologised for the mix up! the room was tiny and the walls had mould on them. I am not fussy but when my mother woke up with insect bites, i was disgusted!we decided to just try and enjoy our weekend away anyway! Breakfast conisted of 3 choices of ceraels, bread rolls (not croissants) and tea/coffee - all of which we had to get ourselves through the crowded room. when we were checking out, we were told that their was a phone call at 7am that morning from someone!!! We asked who called and were told 'I forgot to write his name down'. We were told that they had tried to put the call through which I dont believe for a second as we were awake at the time. Checking out, there was no thank you and no apology for the mix up. This kind of 'hotel'! should be closed down as it gives foreign tourists a bad impression of London.

Reviews.Title: “Inexpensive,no frills hotel! Excellent location for price.”
Reviews.Author: Lisa22Edinburgh
Reviews.Content: Firstly, I would say that the reviews that I read before my boyfriend and I went away did worry me but I thought I would give it the benefit of the doubt. However, I think most of the reviews are exaggerated and people obviously didn't realise a 3* hotel in the centre of London would be the standard of the Ritz clearly not done their research if you ask me!!!!! When we arrived we did have to wait in reception in order to check in and get our key card as the reception area did seem to be under staffed. Not the warmest of welcomes to be honest. We were allocated a room on the 3rd floor, yes the room was small but it was clean and to be honest we were more interested in seeing the sites of London than lounging about the hotel room.
